meanings.definition: The process of producing a photograph on a silver-coated copper plate.
meanings.sent1: Daguerreotyping requires a special plate for capturing images.
meanings.sent2: I learned about daguerreotyping in my photography class.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop had a daguerreotyping kit from the 1800s!
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a daguerreotyping, capturing every detail vividly.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed the art of daguerreotyping beautifully.

meanings.definition: To create a photograph using the daguerreotype process.
meanings.sent1: Photographers used to daguerreotype portraits in the 19th century.
meanings.sent2: I want to learn how to daguerreotype old-fashioned style photos.
meanings.sent3: He tried to daguerreotype his cat, but it kept moving!
meanings.sent4: Her smile daguerreotyped happiness in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The artist daguerreotyped the landscape with precision and skill.
